definition[0]: to become weaker and unable to continue in an effective way
example[0]: The economy is showing signs of faltering.
example[1]: My mother’s grip upon the household never faltered.
definition[1]: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping
example[2]: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
definition[2]: to become less certain and determined that you want to do something
example[4]: We must not falter in our resolve.
definition[3]: to stop walking or to walk in an unsteady way because you suddenly feel weak or afraid
